headline: Why Meta Platforms Stock Soared on AI News Today
summary: A media report stated that the company is planning major enhancements for its advertisers.  This involves a notable expansion of AI functionalities.  Many investors were jumping aboard Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) stock on Monday, so much so that the pricey social media company's shares rose by almost 4%.

headline: Why Meta Platforms Stock Jumped 18% in May
summary: Meta jumped on a strong earnings report and a thaw in U.S. and China tensions.  The social media giant may also be benefiting from trouble at Alphabet.  Shares of Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) were moving higher last month after the social media giant jumped on a better-than-expected earnings report, and the stock gained again in the second week of May on news of a detente in the trade war between the U.S. and China.

Shares of Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META) were moving higher last month after the social media giant jumped on a better-than-expected earnings report, and the stock gained again in the second week of May on news of a detente in the trade war between the U.S. and China.

headline: S&P 500's breakout May was largely a result of Mag 7 gains
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) clocked its best month of trading in May since 1990, and the majority of the Magnificent Seven — comprised of tech stocks Meta Platforms (META), Microsoft (MSFT), Alphabet (GOOGL, GOOG), Amazon (AMZN), Apple (AAPL), Nvidia (NVDA), Tesla (TSLA) — may be deserving of some of the credit. Yahoo Finance host Julie Hyman recaps the Mag 7 stock gains and how it contributed to the S&P 500's breakout May. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Tempus AI rebound, Meta's AI ad push, Broadcom earnings optimism
summary: Market Domination co-host Julie Hyman tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute. Tempus AI (TEM) shares jump after TD Cowen responded to a recent short report, calling some of its claims exaggerated. Advertising stocks fall as Meta (META) reportedly plans to fully automate ad creation and targeting with artificial intelligence (AI) by the end of next year, according to The Wall Street Journal. Meanwhile, Broadcom (AVGO) shares rise ahead of its June 5 earnings report. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Pension investments, Meta ads & AI, Nvidia: Trending Tickers
summary: The California State Teachers Retirement System — the second largest public pension fund in the US — has increased its holdings in D-Wave Quantum (QBTS) and Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT, DJTWW), according to its latest filings. Meta Platforms (META) plans to automate its advertising using AI, according to a Wall Street Journal report. After reporting first quarter earnings results last week, Wall Street investors continue to digest Nvidia's (NVDA) performance and its stock's performance on the print. headline: Meta aims to fully automate advertising with AI by 2026, WSJ reports
summary: The social media company's apps have 3.43 billion unique active users globally and its AI-driven tools help create personalized ad variations, image backgrounds and automated adjustments to video ads, making it lucrative for advertisers.  A brand could provide a product image and a budget, and Meta's AI would generate the ad, including image, video and text, and then determine user targeting on Instagram and Facebook with budget suggestions, the report said.  Meta also plans to let advertisers personalize ads using AI, so that users see different versions of the same ad in real time, based on factors such as geolocation, according to the report.

raw.headline: Meta aims to fully automate advertising with AI by 2026, WSJ reports
raw.summary: The social media company's apps have 3.43 billion unique active users globally and its AI-driven tools help create personalized ad variations, image backgrounds and automated adjustments to video ads, making it lucrative for advertisers.  A brand could provide a product image and a budget, and Meta's AI would generate the ad, including image, video and text, and then determine user targeting on Instagram and Facebook with budget suggestions, the report said.  Meta also plans to let advertisers personalize ads using AI, so that users see different versions of the same ad in real time, based on factors such as geolocation, according to the report.
